thread.title: 9 Uber Fare Estimates For The Busiest Air Travel Routes
thread.title_full: 9 Uber Fare Estimates For The Busiest Air Travel Routes

author: Daniel Carlin
title: 9 Uber Fare Estimates For The Busiest Air Travel Routes
text:
9 Uber Fare Estimates For The Busiest Air Travel Routes Enjoy the ride. Daniel Carlin Editorial Fellow, The Huffington Post Posted: 09/04/2015 11:29 AM EDT 
Surely you've used Uber before, the ridiculously convenient car service disrupting markets worldwide . But have you ever considered taking it for an actual ride? By which we mean, slightly further down the street than your local dive bar? Well, we have. We actually sat down and thought, Wow, how expensive do you think Uber can get? What if you, like, took Uber across the country? 
So we set out to check. 
Going off of the Department of Transportation's top busiest air routes (April 2014 to March 2015), we checked how expensive it would be for you to take an Uber instead of a plane. Our findings are as follows ... surge not included . Jeff Chiu/AP 1. Chicago, IL to New York City, NY: $1,068 Daniel Carlin 2. Los Angeles, CA to San Francisco, CA: $548 Daniel Carlin 3. Los Angeles, CA to New York, NY: $4,033 Daniel Carlin 4. Chicago, IL to Los Angeles, CA: $2,805 Daniel Carlin 5. Chicago, IL to Minneapolis, MN: $556 Daniel Carlin 6. Miami, FL to New York City, NY: $1,725 Daniel Carlin 7. Atlanta, GA to New York City, NY: $974 Daniel Carlin 8. Chicago, IL to Atlanta, GA: $930 Daniel Carlin 9. Atlanta, GA to Orlando, FL: $654 Daniel Carlin 
Uber declined HuffPost's request for comment.
